name: The Westin Denver Downtown

reviews.text: Great location for Rockies game. Outdoor pool and indoor pool. Our room was ready when we checked in at 12:30PM but when we got in it I noticed that there was a jar of peanuts stuck in the cushion of the arm chair and what appeared to be small feathers on the floor under and behind the arm chair and a hair curler clip. I called for housekeeping before we left for the pool and when we came back the peanuts and the hair curler clip was gone but the feathers were still on the floor behind the chair. I called again for housekeeping to come up which they did while we were out again and this time it was done. I was afraid to use the glasses that were provided since vacuuming was not a priority I was afraid of how the glasses were cleaned. I checked the bed and pillows to see if they were clean and they seemed clean. It was a nice hotel but they do not pay attention to housekeeping.
reviews.title: Weekend in Denver

likes.liked: — Proximity to shopping and sports events
likes.disliked: — cleanliness and I didn't feel the staff were very friendly

reviews.text: My fiance and I booked through the hotel on a points and cash rate. Check was fast and easy and the service was great. They upgraded us to a nice room on the top floor. Bedding, bathroom and decor was beautiful. They even sent up fruit and wine on the house. Everyone was helpful, telling us where to go and giving recommendations. The only thing was the parking, very expensive...they allow others to park in their garage and the fee is expensive..26 a day. We did not eat there, so no comment on food. The location cant be beat, right next to ESPNZONE and the 16th street mall. We would totally stay here again as it was the best stay we have ever had.
reviews.title: Best stay ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at Westins in Dublin and St. Louis I decided to go with a safe choice for our night out sans kids in downtown Denver. We checked in at 1 and our room wasn't ready until 2:45 due to short staffing on the cleaning end. Great location but wasn't impressed otherwise. Our room was on the 14th floor and faced west which I requested and appreciated having that request honored. The room itself was rather small. The bathroom was disappointing as well. Almost could have been a bathroom in a motel. The entertainment center and TV were dated and we chose not to watch a pay per view because of the fuzzy picture. Bed was okay, not luxurious and the pillows touched the mattress. I would definitely choose another hotel in the area as there are many. Compared to where we've stayed on other visits The Westin felt substandard. The plumbing was loud and slow. The bath towels weren't of high quality either. Compared to our stays at the other Westin locations I felt like this one was a less than 4 star and some "other" chain hotel.
reviews.title: Westin name not a guarantee of expectations at this location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very accomodating and luxurious. We had a room on the 10th floor facing the Rockies that was excellent and very comfortable. You can't beat the location, with it standing right on the 16th Street Mall! Even better was sitting in the Starbucks on the ground floor and watching the Mets leave the hotel to go to their noon game that day!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

likes.disliked: — they still make you pay for internet access!

reviews.text: I had a very nice stay at the Westin Tabor Center for a convention. The rooms are pleasant and large. I was on the 13th floor and had a beautiful view of the rockies. The service was excellent! I was wandering through the lobby looking a little lost and the director of operations stopped to help me and offered terrific restaurant recommendations. The concierge Brian was great as was everyone else, from the waitresses to the housekeepers. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Tabor Center for 3 nights at the end of April, 2006. The hotel is in a great location in downtown Denver on the 16th street mall, which is a pedestrian street lined with shops and restaurants. It is also adjacent to LoDo, the cool district of Denver with many good places to eat. Also within a block are Writer's Square and Larimer Square, which is the super-trendy block of yet more shops and restaurants. Coors Field (baseball), Invesco Field at Mile High (football), and the Pepsi Center (hockey and basketball) are also within walking distance. Our room had the Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Bath, which meant a fluffy duvet and pillows on the bed and a good shower with 2 heads that had good pressure. The towels were touted as Heavenly, and I found them to be pretty good as far as hotel towels are concerned. The room was clean and updated, and I felt comfortable there. The room was quiet too, which I appreciated because I am a light sleeper. We only split an order of chicken fingers and fries from room service, so while that was good, I can't comment on the dining choices at the Westin. Also, this was the second time we stayed there, and both times visiting NBA teams were staying in the hotel (for what that is worth). In short, the Westin Tabor Center is a great choice when visiting Denver, and we'll stay there if we return to Denver.
reviews.title: Westin Tabor Works for Me

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel recently for a convention. I stay in Westin's frequently and have always enjoyed them. This hotel is not up to the chain's standards (and is not even close to the level of a W).
reviews.title: Not real heavenly

reviews.text: Good items first - the location is great. The food was fine and the staff overall was very pleasant. The meeting rooms are excellent.
reviews.title: Very Nice - Great Location

reviews.text: There is tons to do nearby. I wish I had had more time to walk around the 16th street mall.
reviews.title: Very mediocore

reviews.text: The major issue has been alluded to in these posts before - the hotel does not consistently use "heavenly" products. In my room one of the 3 towels was a heavenly product. The mattress on the bed was not - it really was amazingly hard as several other posts have indicated. I asked the maid and she confirmed that "real" westin products were in short supply at the hotel and other items were being used. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Great Location with Relaxed Style
The nicest Westin I've stayed in
reviews.text: I can't believe the negative reviews I'm reading here. I don't travel often, but when I do, I usually stay at Westin hotels, and the Tabor Center is the nicest one I've stayed in.

reviews.title: Heavenly Bed / Sleepless Night
reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful, and the desk clerks were extremely helpful, friendly and sociable. We asked one if he had heard of a certain restaurant, and he immediately pulled out a downtown map and showed us how to get there. The woman who booked our room gave us the choice of a regular or corner room; we chose the corner. The next morning, the same woman asked us if we enjoyed the corner room! Great service!

reviews.title: What is the problem with Westin hotels
reviews.text: The room was small, but what do you expect for any downtown hotel? The bathroom was perfunctory, but the Heavenly Bed was perfect as usual (the No. 1 reason to stay at Westin).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this trip through hotwire and got a great deal of under a $100 a night. Although there were many negative reviews I think that they are unfounded. I thought that the location was excellent, right in the heart of downtown. I also thought that the room was spacious and updated. Their heavenly towels were great. Also, this hotel has a great indoor/outdoor pool and hottub. I found everything to be quite nice.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place

reviews.text: There are many finer choices in downtown Denver. Don't waste your money at this hotel!
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — Too many issues with the room

reviews.text: Where to begin........I checked in on Wednesday, August 13th and stayed for one night. The hotel itself is in a convenient downtown location. You can walk 5 blocks to Union Station, you can walk 1 block to the free 16th Street Mall bus stop, and you can walk 2 blocks to the Market Street bus plaza where you can catch the "AF" bus to Denver Airport. The "AF" bus is a great way to get to DIA. Check Denver RTD's website for pickup times. Travel time is one hour, and cost is $9 payable in cash to the driver (exact change required). Super Shuttle also serves the Westin Hotel, and the cost is $19 to DIA. Super Shuttle picks up in the lobby of the hotel every 20 to 30 minutes all day long.
reviews.title: Westin Tabor Center Denver Excellent Stay

reviews.text: When I checked into the hotel, the process was smooth with no problems. However, when I got up to my room (Room #1714), I could see that I was put into a handicapped room. The room is slightly larger, but the bathroom is setup much differently than the non-handicapped rooms. I called down to the front desk to ask if this was a handicapped room to see what I would be told. The gal I spoke to said yes, this is a handicapped room. I asked her why she didn't tell me this when I checked in. She then told me that the room is identical to all of the other rooms except it is a bit larger to accommodate wheelchairs, and the shower has a metal grab bar in it. I told her that I thought all Westin rooms had the "Heavenly Shower", and she said this is correct and my room has this featured shower. I told her no, this is not the case, as my shower has a special detachable single shower head (not the dual-jet Heavenly Shower head), and there is not one grab bar in the shower but three! She was unaware of this, and did not offer a change of rooms (and I did not ask, either, as it was late and I just wanted to get some sleep). Also, the entire shower/tub/tile and the bathroom counter are all original and were NOT refurbished when this hotel had all the rooms redone. It looks the same as it did 10 years ago. Why did the Westin Tabor Center not refurbish the bathrooms in the handicapped rooms like they did all of the other rooms??? You can also see from the photo of the tub that the base of it has brown, ground-in dirt from years of use. This is not acceptable.
reviews.title: Just Fine. Nice Hotel.

reviews.text: As you can see from my pictures, the shower itself is very "industrial" and is not to my liking at all. The toilet is obviously a different model for use in this room because it is extremely low to the floor. I'm not sure how well it shows in my picture, but I am six feet tall and when using the toilet, my knees are almost up in my chest because of this thing being so low to the floor. I felt like John Candy in the movie, "Uncle Buck" walking into the little boys room at the grade school of his nephew where everything is down-sized. I felt ridiculous sitting there trying to use this "different" toilet!
reviews.title: Perfect for Business

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Westin for two nights in late July and absolutely loved it. The service was far beyond expectations and the health facilities were great. As always at a Westin, the rooms were clean and comfortable. I would disagree with the ireview that suggested this should be a Sheraton. The location is terrific if you want to see downtown Denver as it is right on 16th street for the free shuttle. It is also easy walking distance from Coors Field.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
Nice location
reviews.text: Stayed here recently for a conference at the convention center. Was very pleased with rooms, gym, and pool. Location is great near all the best restaurants and within walking distance to the convention center. Rooftop pool was great and has a nice view of the mountains. Rooms were large. Bathrooms were nice although no seperate tub/shower. Overall excellent value.

The Tabor certainly lived up to the Westin standards, thanks primarily to an overly accomodating staff. Blessed with a location convenient to many of Denver's attractions, the Tabor boasts well-appointed rooms featuring the now legendary heavenly bed; unfortunately, the comfort level for remainder of the furniture could best be deemed as hellish -- looks great, but difficult to relax in or work from. The nitpicking aside, the staff was exceptional, from check in to check out. Although a tad sterile, almost minimalistic in design, the hotel was well-maintained. Room service was prompt, and the fare was restaurant quality. Be sure to check out the health center. Overall, an enjoyable two-night stay in May...
reviews.title: Great staff, nice hotel...

reviews.text: I have no idea why the June 5th three star reviewer wrote that the rooms look "tired". Everything the June 5th reviewer complained about did not occur during my stay, I wonder if they are confusing the Westin Tabor Center with a different hotel. This hotel looks like it was newly built last month! The hotel lobby had the class and atmosphere of a W hotel and the room was so clean it felt like I was the first guest to occupy it. The heavenly bed and bath is the standard which all hotel rooms should be judged. I love the fact that the hotel is connected to the shopping center and right near 16th street. I can just walk over to the food court and grab someting quick. Service was excellent and the front desk employee was very helpful in giving me walking directions to the hockey game. There is nothing to complain about regarding this Westin Hotel. Don't believe anyone who rates this hotel less than above average.
reviews.title: Clean, Modern and High Class

reviews.text: My husband and I travel often and we were extremely pleased by our stay at the Westin Tabor Center over the Thanksgiving Holiday! The staff was very friendly and helpful! The lounge in the lobby was comfortable, the breakfast buffet was delicious and the Starbucks inside the hotel was convenient!
reviews.title: Awesome service, facility & location

reviews.text: Our 14th floor room had a great view, plush bedding and nice furnishings.
reviews.title: Satisfied. Very nice.
Dirty Water for Your Shower
reviews.text: I've never seen a hotel have a more perfect location to shopping, dining, night spots, and sporting events!
If that's not good enough for you, while we were there, The Rolling Stones and the NBA LA Clippers were staying at this Westin (yes, we saw them)!
reviews.title: Ogod You Guys Are Eatin Dirt
Surperb Customer Service!
reviews.text: I was attending a conference for work and stayed for 4 nights (Sat-Tues); with the seminar being held there at the Westin, it was great to stay in one location and get the business room rate.

reviews.title: Amazing location & Great staff
reviews.text: The customer service was outstanding! All staff were friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make sure I was taken care-of during my stay. On my first day, I needed to do some shopping and ended-up renting a car. They assisted every step of the way, printing maps and helping me secure a rental car (they even called and got rates to compare). A special thank you to the young lady at the desk who got me the directions to the Bass Pro shop! I appreciated her help a great deal.

reviews.title: An unusual Westin but nice stay
reviews.text: Another evening they helped with printing my boarding passes, and I was even able to get a great cup of hot chocolate while I checked my email! Overall, they were one of the most customer-related hotels I have ever experienced.

reviews.title: Exceptional Staff
reviews.text: The layout of the hotel is nice, and the elevators are fast! There is lots to do around the hotel area, and the 16th street bus was very handy, but being downtown - there were still times I was hassled for spare change and I felt like I should avoid walking down some streets. There is a Cheese Cake Factory in the same Westin building along with the Palm, ESPN Sports bar, and a Starbucks, as well as several other places to eat.

reviews.title: Solid Westin
reviews.text: The room was clean, and I loved the huge bay window. I took some great pics of the tall buildings, but you had to go to the 4th floor (by the pool) to see the mountains. Everything was clean, equiped with all of the things you need (coffee maker, hair dryer, iron) and it was great that they had a in-room safe. I must have been on a quiet floor (10th), because I didn't hear anyone until the last day (but someone mentioned that they were in a room by the elevator and heard it all night).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great room, bed, location, service, fast elevators, and to top our wonderful visit to denver, there was complimentary - delicious- guacamole being made and served in the lobby on one of the evenings. how fun was that? our room was reasonable in addition to all the above.
reviews.title: all this and guacamole, too

reviews.text: Found $107 rate on Hotwire for a Sunday night. Arrived to find large, gracious lobby and friendly staff, who considerately found us a room "high in the tower, with a good view." This put us on the "Starwood Preferred Guest Floor" with great city views. (There was no extra charge from the original rate.) The room was large, with two double beds and a huge bay window. The room had a flat-screen TV. The bathroom was also large, very clean, with new-looking modern fixtures. Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea are provided in the room. Having our small son with us, we checked out the pool, which is small; fortunately it wasn't crowded. The pool deck is very large with lots of lounging furniture, tables etc... would be nice to have cocktails there. In all the guest areas of the hotel, modern decor prevails in cool grays and greens-- very tasteful and soothing. Also, they use a "white tea" fragrance for all their bath products that is absolutely divine (even the lobby smells good). On the negative side, parking is not included in the nightly rate, and the ramp is prohibitively expensive, causing us to use a pay lot one block away. Also, there is no vending... sodas and snacks available at desk for astronomical price. Wi-Fi in the rooms will cost you a "connection fee," as will a local call.
reviews.title: Elegant decor, helpful staff, nice rooms; good value.

reviews.text: I feel that it was a good value for me, because the rate was so low; but if I had paid $150 or more, the cost of the add-ons would have left me peeved.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with friendly staff and great location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We had a renovated room on the 8th floor. This hotel is definitely a large conference type hotel and I have to say I normally hate those types of places. Lobby is quite large, renovated, modern decor, and has free wifi, but you have to pay for wifi in the room. Bar is open late. Quite a few large meetings were going on at the hotel but given it's size you are not inconvienenced and the staff is super friendly. Our room was modern and very clean, nice size and of course the much advertised heavenly bed. Could be a sign of the times, they were stingy with the bath products, we only got one hand cream, one shampoo, one conditioner, and one soap,all mini size during our 3 day stay. Maid service can come anytime between 8-5, we had to call them to make up our room at 4:30 because they had not shown up all day. I would definitely stay here again, better location than the Ritz. If you self-park, it's much cheaper and faster to get your car in and out. Can walk to pretty much anything of importance downtown or take a quick cab ride. Full service starbucks inside the hotel as well the hotel's own restaurant. They have some rooms that have workout equipment inside them, so check them out if you are interested.
reviews.title: Pretty Average Stay

reviews.text: Yes, our stay at the Denver Westin Tabor Center was average. It wasn't really bad, just nothing to write home about. The room was quite enough and clean enough and the Heavenly Bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location and recently updated rooms

aka: The Westin Denver Downtown Hotel Denver
description: The Westin Denver Downtown Hotel is a four-diamond hotel located in the Tabor Center, located near the famous 16th Street Mall, Colorado's leading tourist destination.
